website_summaries.verdict: Smaller and lighter than a typical messenger bag but still able to hold a pro dSLR body, a flash, a couple of small lenses, and a 13-inch laptop, the Tenba Mini Photo/Laptop Messenger Bag is one of the best-designed bags we've seen.
pros: The Tenba Mini Photo/Laptop Messenger Bag is a compact, well-designed, and attractive bag that can hold a surprising amount of equipment
cons: There are some odd omissions, such as there being no place for a large keychain, and the nylon exterior attracts a lot of schmutz

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty stitching, tough, well made
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged bag and good looking. The product photos show what it will hold and all sides except the back. The back is padded and has a breathable mesh. I think you could fashion this into a large fannie pack by using an adjustable belt of some sort. The shoulder strap is also nicely padded with swivel clips. The only negative I have is that the bottom is fabric. It still may be waterproof but I would have preferred a rubber coating so when you set it down on wet surfaces you would feel more confident that your gear will stay dry. All in all this was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: misterdaveusa

customer_reviews.title: Great bag but don't be fooled by the word Mini
customer_reviews.text: Great bag but don't be fooled by the word Mini. It is not that small and that is a good thing. I'm able to fit my Olympus OM-D10 with the 14-150 mm Lens attached, my Olympus Pen E-PL5 with the 12-50 mm EZ lens attached and five other Micro four third lens, a small flash, extra batteries and accessories. There is still room for an iPad or a small thin laptop. There is a back zip up pocket for camera manual, note pad or maybe your phone. I love the extra top zipper opening for easy and fast access to your camera. The bag is very well made and of good quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mencer

customer_reviews.title: A great, improved  photo/everyday messanger bag.
customer_reviews.text: I had the large version of this bag for a long time and needed to replace. There were a couple of minor issues with the older bags. The d-rings previously were able to move too freely and started wearing the straps, same with the handle. Both of these issues have been fixed with newer version. The small version is just a little smaller than the large but perfect for my needs. Switched from from a full sized DSLR with 3 lenses and flash to a mirrorless camera and didn't need all that room. I did still need something big enough to hold a 15in laptop. This totally fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: echoman

customer_reviews.title: My best Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: One of the best camera bags I own. I took a flight recently and used it as a carry-on. I had my 70D with 24-70 lens on it. With 3 additional lenses, flash, Tascam -DR-05, and my gro-pro. My 17" laptop and Ipad. Some files, and various cables, and things.... I was amazed at how much I could fit into this bag. It was heavy once I loaded it down, but you could get a ton in it. It was comfortable to carry around the airport. I highly recommend this bag for a traveling photographer/hobbyist that want a more discrete bag to carry their gear.
customer_reviews.author: C. Guido

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, super practical...GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I needed something bigger but not too big, this one is the perfect size, fits a Nikon D90 with 18/55 lens, a Olympus OM-D mark2 with a '14/42 lens and plenty of room for my wallet,glasses,etc... I like all the pockets,compartments...the color is great, the material nice...and one thing that I like a lot and helped me on my last trip is the zipper that lets you get your camera without having to open the flap...is great! I'm really pleased with this camera bag...I got a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: carmen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for small - medium m43 kit
customer_reviews.text: Trucked all over the UK with this bag and my M43 kit. I had an Olympus OMD-EM1, 12-40 2.8, 75-300 4.8-6.7, a Samygung Fisheye lens, a flash, extra battery charger, 3 batteries, 3 memory cards and this thing and it held up like a champ! Shoulder strap was very comfortable for me, and the top loading zipper was a real life safer. I don't like having my camera out longer than it needs to be, so this bag was good at keeping things discrete. Recently replaced the 75-300 with a much much larger 40-150 2.8, Still able to carry everything mentioned above, but it is getting a bit cramped. Leave out the Flash and you would be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wesala

customer_reviews.title: Feels solid and held everything I needed
customer_reviews.text: At first this bag seemed like it would be too big but after trying the small and medium size, this turned out to be perfect. The inside just never seems to hold as much as you thing it will which caused the upgrades But this bag is solidly made. It was used on a 2 week trip carting equipment everywhere and I found it to be comfortable, have convenient pockets and excellent padding. The zippers worked perfectly and feel well made. We'll see if withstands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: R C

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like Velcro.
customer_reviews.text: Strong material. Fits a A7iii body and couple of lenses. Still able to zip the bag with a Canon 70-200 lens w Sigma adapter on the body. A shoulder bag is more ideal when dealing with crowds. Backpacks get in the way. Only dislike is the Velcro if I want to open the flap all the way. It is very strong Velcro, but too loud at times.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Temba has the best camera bags on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Tenba bag and I use this one the most. My first was a little bigger, which I've had for years. With this one, I can load a full sized DSLR, 2 lenses, flash and still have plenty of room for odds and ends. I usually don't carry a purse when I do shoots, so this even has space to take some essentials. The Temba bags are consistently well made and I really like that I can personalize the interior with the changeable padded compartments.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: best camera messenger bag for international travel
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that didn't automatically identify me as a tourist. The Tenba Messenger Camera Bag was exactly what I was looking for. There was enough room for my Canon Rebel T2i, an extra lens, battery, and memory cards, my cell phone and the charger for the T2i battery. And there was room for more stuff that I accumulated throughout my trip. The zipper at the top let me access all portions of the bag with ease. And bonus, we got poured on in Florence, Italy. The Tenba Messenger Camera Bag kept all of my electronics from getting wet! Definitely a must have if you are traveling internationally and don't want to stick out like a sore-thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Bag passed the first test with no problems!
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a smaller sized non-discript bag for travel. Passed the first test with flying colors. Was able to pack my D800, filters. two lens, batteries, chargers and memory cards along with my Mac air. Going on a longer trip to Thailand-Cambodia where the bag will get the "final exam" but based on my first trip expect no problems.
customer_reviews.author: joewp

customer_reviews.title: This is a sweet bag. The combination of the style and functionality ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a sweet bag. The combination of the style and functionality are perfect and exactly what I was looking for. I use it to carry by Macbook Pro 13 inch laptop and Canon 6D with 16-24 f2.8 L and 70-200mm f4 lenses. At first I was concerned the small wouldn't hold my 200mm lens, but I was wrong. It fits in there just fine. It also holds my 24-70mm perfectly as well. Perfect bag for my needs, exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Stromee

customer_reviews.title: perfect for OM-D
customer_reviews.text: The bag meets all my needs perfectly. Full OM-D system with 12-50 zoom and three prime lenses all with hoods and lots of room for filters. batteries, charger, flash and more. Front zip pockets not a lot of use apart from putting in tickets but apart from that well thought out and well constructed bag. Doesn't scream camera case and is a nice usable size. I suspect it will look even better with some age. Shoulder strap is comfortable for me but I may put a sliding shoulder pad on to make things a bit easier. Did lots of research and I'm very pleased with the result.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyBuoy

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for travel with DSLR and laptop
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bag. Very solid construction. Lots of useful pockets. Fits my Nikon D5100 w/ lens, flash, 13" macbook, couple hard drives, bose headphones, water bottle, and a couple energy bars. Also put my phones, travel documents, and a few extras in there as well. I don't use the top zipper at all as it is just as easy to lift the flap. Really like the removable/padded insert. Also like that it doesn't highlight all of the stuff I have inside. Very inconspicuous and doesn't attract attention.
customer_reviews.author: Twins Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Quality, Quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag fits everything for my cityscape to event shoots. Super durable canvas, great zippers, plenty of packets. It hold my 70-200, 24-70 attached to my sony a77ii, and my Godox speed flash. Plus hard drives MacBook Pro, IPod and much more. Temnba = quality! End of story.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, it came with a divider insert for holding you professional camera if that is what you are using it for which is great. I however and using it as a laptop bag. There is a pad away for the laptop pocket space as well as padding on the outside back of the bag which gives good protection. There are tons of compartments all other the bag which is great. The strap on the bag is nicely curved and padded to fit well on your shoulder. The clasps for the bag strap are nice and durable also.
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Well made and ideal way to travel with core camera gear when on business
customer_reviews.text: Great product well made. No regrets -- use this to hold my 13" Macbook, Canon T5i w/24-105MM attached, flash and additional lense(s). Strap has good padding and lots of pockets to hold additional gear. Good complement to my Think Tank Airport Essentials backpack when I don't want to take a ton of gear. Use when travelling on business to opportunistically shoot cities I visit.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Tenba bags are always a good decision.
customer_reviews.text: Tenba bags are always good. They are built very well and are meant to last for a very long time through rough use. This bag is no exception.I have had the Tenba DNA 15 bag for roughly 2 years and put that bag through the ringer. It still holds up. I expect no less of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great day bag or weekend adventurer.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my A6000, a few spare lenses, cables, charger, iPad Pro fits in the laptop sleeve in it's case and cover. And there is still too much room! Can easily fit your phone, flash, and a few other accessories in this bag with some room to still spare. Also the orange in the photos is brighter than it really is. Think of the "burnt orange" color you see on current vehicles, it's about that brightness.
customer_reviews.author: SkudShark

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need!
customer_reviews.text: I have not traveled with my bag yet but I did try it out. I was able to put my 15 inch laptop in the back compartment. My Nikon D90 with the 35-70 mm lens attached, my 11-16 mm wide angle lens and my 70-200mm telephoto lens in the removable compartment. Along with the above I place my Nexus 7 table in the bag along with the chargers for camera and all devices plus I have room for other things I will need for traveling. Yes, the bag is pretty heavy but the nice shoulder strap is nice and padded. It's a great bag and will fit my needs nicely.
customer_reviews.author: CindyLuWho

customer_reviews.title: Have a 13" MacBook and a small Kit this bag is for you.
customer_reviews.text: I have several bags in this series and love them all. I did return this bag due to not fitting my intended purpose. The exterior pockets are very tight but for a photographer with a 13" laptop this is an amazing deal.
customer_reviews.author: IBUYSTUFF

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for travel when you don't want to take a photo backpack
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well made messenger style photo bag. I use it when traveling and don't want to bring my backpack. It comfortably holds a Nikon D500 with 300mm F4 attached and a D750 with an 85mm F1.8 attached. It isn't fully weatherproof but should work well in anything except a sustained driving downpour. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Waldo Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Camera Bag for portable Astrophotography
customer_reviews.text: This a great bag! Lots of room, well made, very sturdy, perfect for my needs. I bought this to haul a portable astrophotography tracking mount, the Star Adventurer by Sky Watcher. The mount, equatorial base, counter weight, camera, lens and intervalometer all fit with room to spare. I can sling it over my should and go. This bag can hold everything I need to bring a tracking mount and camera to a distant dark sky site. The only other equipment I'm hauling is a sturdy tripod, that goes on my other shoulder as this bag has no provisions to strap a tripod to it.
customer_reviews.author: NickL

customer_reviews.title: My Workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: I own a few different bags but this is my favorite. When I'm shooting a job, it holds my Canon 5DMII, 50mm, 35mm, 85mm and 70-200. I put my iPad in it for clients to sign contracts and see photos. My 13" Macbook fits as well! The best feature of the bag is the zipper at the top that opens the bag without unclicking the bag. I can access all my lenses on the fly when shooting children's photography. I can throw in a flash in there as well, but I have to remove one of the tiny prime lenses. Green one rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: My trusted favorite
customer_reviews.text: This is my third bag in this series from Tenba. Obviously I love them. The only reason that I’ve been through so many is that it’s been twenty years and I travel a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W. Swartz

customer_reviews.title: ... 6 days but already this is one of my favorite bags. Held my DSLR body and three lenses ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only owned it for 6 days but already this is one of my favorite bags. Held my DSLR body and three lenses snugly and securely on a vacation. Inserts velcro off to hold my laptop and a water bottle for daily commuting. Cell phone and keys always within reach and my Leatherman stays strapped to the side expansion loops (military functionality without being overly "tacticool" is a big plus). Build quality seems great so I doubt I'll be updating this review in the future.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag just not my preference
customer_reviews.text: Returned. Well designed and nice material but too big for my usage. I was hoping "small" in the description was truer. Even if the dimensions were suited for me I would probably still have returned because the Velcro patches to hold the flap closed seemed overkill in addition to the buckles. They were four times bigger than they needed to be and were loud and "nails on chalkboard" ever time I opened and closed.
customer_reviews.author: GeoR

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag and construction but too heavy for traveling
customer_reviews.text: The purpose to purchased this messenger bag is for my trip to Europe. The bag arrived very quick and nice packaging, however, it is a lot bigger than what i thought although it said "small" messenger bag. It could hold my 5D3 with 24-70mm F2.8 + 70-200mm F2.8 + a prime lens. The bag itself is already heavy and with my gear I felt very uncomfortable to carry so I ended up bringing my backpack instead. I give 4 stars because the construction and design is nice but maybe not a perfect bag for small and skinny people.
customer_reviews.author: MiniKa

customer_reviews.title: Great Multi-Use Bag
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Bag. I really like this bag and I can actually fit my Dell 17" XPS wide screen Laptop with the extended battery in it for travel. No, I can't carry a lot of camera gear at the same time; but then again why would I? I can remove the insert and use it as a Laptop bag or a Camera Shoulder Bag. Lots of pockets and an easy access through the top. Looks good too. I wish it had some sort of rain fly though, only down side. Otherwise, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dave C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: I strongly recommend this camera bag to any one. I recently toured the Natioanl Parks of Utah and was able to have at my fingertips all of my camera gear I needed. The bag comfortably held my 70-200 2.8, 16-85, 2X tele ext., 35 1.8, and a flash unit. The bag fit nicely in my overhead store for each of my flights( not normal for me in the past with other bags on regional flights). This bag has less bulk and a very sleek design that masks the fact that it is a camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: SeldomseenPA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag for a few months now as a sling bag for wedding work- I LOVE the quick access zipper while I'm busy running around and need to grab something quick. It fits a good chunk of my equipment for on-body shooting, and I have a second backpack style bag for lighting equipment and extra lenses that I give to an assistant to carry. I am able to fit a Canon 5dMarkII, 24-70 f2.8L, 70-200 f2.8L ISII, 50 f1.4, and a 100 f2.8L IS (using extra velcro dividers I had on hand) along with a slew of batteries and CF cards in the outside pockets.
customer_reviews.author: AvidShopper

customer_reviews.title: Tenba Mini Messenge Bag
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Tenba bag for a cruise, mainly because I did not want to lug around my camera backpack. The mini proved to be the perfect size allowing me to pack my DSLR and three lenses, plus other camera gear without the bulk of a larger/wider camera bag. The features are great and the bag is narrow, as the description says: "messenger bag", allowing me to easily store it under an airline seat. The materials seem first rate. Finally, the color selection is extensive enough that with the brown one, it didn't look like I was sporting a "man purse".
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This bag is perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for me! It has many compartments for small things a nice spacious middle that includes a removable camera gear insert. And a laptop compartment. I'm able to fit everything I need for my daily use in the bag and still keep it light. I love the removable photography gear insert as it will allow me to bring my camera, flash and lenses when I go on vacation or on photography trips and I can bring my laptop with me as well. Great bag, great price! The color is not bright and over powering it's more like a dull orange. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: bgfilly

customer_reviews.title: Almost what I wanted...
customer_reviews.text: It is constructed well and will hold a laptop and a camera body and a few accessories, but after that things get tight. There is no room left over a book. My battery grip will fit while on the camera only if there is no laptop. There isn't a space for a water bottle, nor a spot for keys. These little things can be important. If there were an Extra Large size, with about 3 inches more depth (front to back) and about the same in length, I would find the bag much more useful.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Evers

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this bag this week. I haven't used it yet but I'm already sure I'll love it. This is a bit bigger than I expected it would be but it will definitely carry all my gear. I'll be putting my D90 with 24-70 lens attached, SB600 and 2 smaller lenses in it with my iPad...and there's plenty of room for batteries, extra cards, etc. It'll be great for traveling. Not sure I'd walk around a city all day with this thing. It's a bit bulky for that. But for getting my gear from one place to another safely and all in one bag, this thing will rock.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for street shooters!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: o Discreet - does not look like a photo bag o Quick access top zipper o Large enough for a day trip o Packs large laptop, camera, 2 more lenses and a flash. Nanostand can be attached externally o Fit and finish of decent quality o Durable - no signs of tear after 3 years Cons: o Exterior is too busy to my taste - exterior pockets are not really needed
customer_reviews.author: AVS

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Excellence!
customer_reviews.text: I have not purchased a camera bag in a while as I have been using a Lowepro camera backpack. For a quick hundy, this is a great value and the bag is very smartly put together....I shoot with small mirrorless cameras doing small business photoshoots and it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vegasphotog

customer_reviews.title: Great bag EXCELLENT customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to carry my camera and the rest of my stuff. my bag developed a bad snap on the shoulder strap that would not allow it to swivel freely. I contacted Tenba and they had me email them my amazon invoice and sent me a NEW handle within a week free of charge! That is awesome customer service! The bag has been perfect, well built after the replacement strap! I will buy more of their products in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Seals

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever
customer_reviews.text: Use this for my 17" acer, fits easily in the laptop section. The front zipper gives full access to the whole inside without pulling up the front flap, very nice feature. two front zippers each hold a large smartphone easily. Bag has lasted with daily use as a briefcase/laptop bag for the last 2 years, and many to come. I will replace it with the same bag, should it ever wear out. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Toobizzee

customer_reviews.title: My standard camera bag when I carry more than two lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy construction. This bag gets constant use and still looks like new. The strap may have to be renewed after a year or two of heavy use but the core bag still looks great. Tenba really doesn't skimp on quality and sturdiness. Would generally recommend their bags over the usual camera bag makers because of this. For Micro Four Thirds shooters you can using the velcro attachments reconfigure how things are laid out in the bag so you can carry two bodies plus up to 5 lenses!
customer_reviews.author: cloudy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I've used one of these for years so I decided to buy another one to use for work. It's the perfect size and it is easy to use and accommodates everything I need to carry with me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Maziarz

customer_reviews.title: the two front zippered pockets are useful for pens or a phone
customer_reviews.text: this is not a light bag. but it is heavy duty and you can fit a lot of junk in here. i fit two micro four thirds cameras and a couple of lenses in the main compartment, a skechbook and a thick art book w/o hassles. the two front zippered pockets are useful for pens or a phone. the back zippered pocket will fit a tablet. the inside zippered pocket can also fit a tablet or a book. very useful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Stealthy city messenger for small DSLR or Mirrorless
customer_reviews.text: Well-designed with many useful pockets for batteries, memory cards, cable switch, remote control etc. Fast delivery, item factory-fresh. I'll definitely buy from this merchant again.
customer_reviews.author: Boonleong Goh

customer_reviews.title: Adequate laptop storage but no support/protection
customer_reviews.text: Not enough support or protection for traveling with a laptop and other devices like a Kindle. The bag collapses on itself when any item is removed. The addition of some flexible padding helps. I chose it because of all the storage pockets but rarely use it due to it's inability to stand alone.
customer_reviews.author: MPH

customer_reviews.title: Well made product ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this product but with the camera insert ... it can be a bit bulky. I've ended up using the insert in a small Timbuk2 bag (works well) and using this as my daily work bag. Great storage and computer access. Wonderful strap and it's just a good bag. Now remember it's not water proof like a Timbuk2 bag but that aside I really like using it as my carry bag. Not even disappointed that I didn't end up using it as intended .. to also carry my Nikon D40.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk-eye

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for travel!
customer_reviews.text: Took this bag to Italy for being a tourist during the day. Fits everything you need to be comfortable. Also great for bringing on-board airplane. If you're already carrying a tablet or small (11") laptop in the bag, the one thing it's not sized right for is magazines, notepads, or newspapers. Study built, looks great. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: AdobemanAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I like this bag so much that I bought a second one that I can use for a computer/book bag. One of the things I like best is that it will stand up and not fall over. I can also attach a bottle holder.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: a great bag, durable
customer_reviews.text: Only problem I had with this bag was that it tipped over, but then I realized that I had stuffed it too full on one side. It is a great bag and I like the fact that I can carry my mapbook pro AND my large DSLR in the middle, fully padded and protected. It works great. The handle seems substantial too, and that's good because this bag weighs a lot when its got everything in it.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Investment!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect bag!!!! I could not ask for a more perfect bag as a photographer! Watch the youtube reviewed and be amazed! Best investment!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Mini for sure
customer_reviews.text: My 13" Lenovo laptop fits so tightly that I'd have to say any given 13" would only have a 50/50 chance of fitting. If you think yours is even slightly on the thick side, forget about it. There are plenty of pockets, but they are also snugly stitched such that even a fat marker seems a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Good looking bag
customer_reviews.text: Good looking bag, love the color; sturdy construction. Enough room for a SLR with prime attached, a zoom lens, and various other small items you would want to carry.
customer_reviews.author: I. M. Elmero

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for a few lenses
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, very well made. Does not have a huge amount of room so it might handle one large DSLR and a couple medium lenses or one small DSLR and three small-medium lenses. Would get something larger if you have large or heavy lenses like the Canon long telephotos. Works great for my wife's D40 and a few lenses but would not do for my 5D Mark III and it's lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Astroman

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a cheap imitation of this bag and then I bought the real thing...well made with quality materials...if you are on a tight budget the imitation will work...I like a better made product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Gress

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Bag!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with the camera bag - very well made and fits my micro four thirds camera and 3 lenses with room to spare. Specially like the fact that you can access your equipment from the zippered top. Padded spacing for an ipad too! Plenty of outside pockets for extra little things. Perfect size for toting around for an all day photo shoot!
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag! Thinking of buying another from Tenba. But I wish they would strengthen the part of the handle strap right where it transitions from the filled (padded) portion to the hollow part of the strap. And maybe they will consider a place for a small tri-pod to be tied to.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good case.
customer_reviews.text: Tenba is a very good brand and this one is not en exception.
customer_reviews.author: POPOLO

customer_reviews.title: Had for years now.  Used a lot.  Holding up extremely well.
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for business and this bag has been superb. Good for work and laptop. Good for camera gear too. I would buy another, but don't see it being necessary as I can't see this bag wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Simon T

customer_reviews.title: Very well made bag.  Holds all I need.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera bag. Bought one for my wife and then a second one for myself. Very well made. Big enough for a D7000 with an 16-300 lens, plus an extra lens, batteries, filters, charger, memory cards, etc. Very handy access on top without having to open the bag.Just what we needed for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: profile

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, not the greatest production
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bag, lots of little places to put all of your stuff. I feel comfortable with it's level of protection for my valuables. My only gripe is that it seems to be fraying a bit already. Little bits of the outer materials are already starting to wear off. I'm not saying I've been walking around with the thing in bubble wrap, it's being used normally. However, I've only had it for two weeks, so it seems a bit soon. It could just be that I'm rougher with it than I realize, but I've had other bags that took a lot longer to start showing these signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Still searching for the perfect should bag for my Oly M1 with a few ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it as larger than I thought and it had the usual overkill of padding making the bag bulkier. Still searching for the perfect should bag for my Oly M1 with a few lenses. iPad too but not a deal killer.
customer_reviews.author: The Garden Geek

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: A great case. This is what I use for my D7100 and 3 lenses. It is bigger that one would expect for a 'mini'. In fact I came to this size by buying the Med and then the small, and finally the mini. I found each to be too large for the gear I commonly carry.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I feel empowered by this bag
customer_reviews.text: A bit larger than I expected, but it stores my a6000 mirrorless + 1 lens just fine, and still have room for an umbrella, 3DS, purse, sketchbook, a Nexus 7 and stationaries. Padded walls inside that can be customized is awesome. Top zipper to access main compartment is why you'll buy this bag. Shoulder strap is pretty uncomfortable when slung on shoulder. It feels way better when slung diagonally across chest. Now if it is only waterproof, it is water resistant but it won't keep stuff dry in heavy rain.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Fits my small laptop great and my camera with lenses
customer_reviews.text: Fits my small laptop great and my camera with lenses. It will work great for my trip the Velcro is load, but holds nicely and the zipper is a nice way to open the top so you don't have to lift the whole flap. The strap is nicely padded and adjustable. Wish it had a side mesh pocket for a water bottle. Then it would be perfect. It's a big bag that hold what I need, it will work as a carry on bag to hold my computer, iPad and camera equipment.
customer_reviews.author: SunGodess

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Bigger than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, but too large for my D7000 and 3 lenses. I ended up with the Mini. The mini is a bit 'stuffed' but not bad enough to be a concern. This is not a weather proof case. The top flap does not extend beyond the sides enough to keep blowing anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. I used it only two trips. I have it up for sales now.
customer_reviews.author: Orville H. Fudpucker

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a long time to find something that would hold my 17 inch laptop, looks great and holds my Nikon camera equipment all in one place. I plan on going on a trip soon and would like to take my camera and laptop with me on the plane and don't want to take more than one bag on the plane. This was the best purchase and the quality is excellent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jolene

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: A very smart and protective bag. I can easily fit in a Nikon D750, 2 lenses, flash and accessories
customer_reviews.author: Taituara

customer_reviews.title: For the price...best messenger bag on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. There's enough room to shove a camera body, 70-200mm lens, and two other medium size lenses...a flash, chargers, cables, fold up reflectors and a small laptop or tablet. It's well built and feels good to carry. It does get a bit heavy after a long day of travel...but what bag wouldn't when it's full of photo gear? I can't imagine there is a better messenger bag out there at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: TJ L

customer_reviews.title: Great bag buy
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot for a mini bag. Excellent quality and will surely hold up for years!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mack

customer_reviews.title: This is a fantastic bag !!!
customer_reviews.text: Although I just received this bag today I loaded it and roll-played with it. This is a fantastic bag, if you watched the video at the Tenba website it is everything they say it is. I’ve checked out other brands but the overall quality of this brand and the pricing for what you get is un-parallel. As my camera bag needs grow I know this is the brand for me.  
customer_reviews.author: bytes675

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it just hoping my strap doesn't break like the ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it just hoping my strap doesn't break like the people in review's said it would
customer_reviews.author: Bubblepatch

customer_reviews.title: best camera bag ever purchased light abundant space in great ...
customer_reviews.text: best camera bag ever purchased light abundant space in great efficient way great cushion and many available place to put accessaries
customer_reviews.author: Jung Oh

customer_reviews.title: Camera Case
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag to carry a D700 with an attached 18-35mm lens and a D7000 with an attached 28-300mm lens together with the lenses facing down. I can retrieve either camera through the top zipper while wearing the bag. It is the perfect solution to easy access during short photographic hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond J. Digiglio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase, it hold everything very organized and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase, it hold everything very organized and light weight, I don't need to use a purse, it holds it all. We travel a lot and I love photography carrying with me several lenses and filters. I used to carry my photography bag, my back pack along with my luggage... the Tenba Messenger replaced my back pack/purse and the photo bag, now combined into one. It also holds cell phone, my Ipad and a small table tripot. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen

customer_reviews.title: Short People Problems
customer_reviews.text: I love how much I can pack into this bag. The only thing that held me back from loving it completely is the limitation on how short I can adjust the shoulder strap. I have a very short torso and wish I could go another two inches shorter with the strap.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila K

customer_reviews.title: Tenba small camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Absolutly the best camera bag I have ever bought. The size was good, not too large, I also had to carry other things when boarding the ship. The prompt service from Tenba was great too. Took the bag to Alaska, held all the lens I wanted to take along & camera plus extra stuff.
customer_reviews.author: P. B.

customer_reviews.title: My EDC Bag
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this bag every day to hold my work equipment. It hold my laptop, cords, notebook, USB drive, and a variety of pens with ease. I did 3 weeks of research before settling on this bag and I have not been disappointed in the least. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Kaltoro

customer_reviews.title: very nice bag
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bag that can carry my laptop and camera gear. This will do very well. Love the colour too even though I was a bit sceptic about it till i saw it. There a lot of pockets which i love but some are very tight. The only reason I returned it because it was a bit large for me.(i am a small woman).
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera/Computer bag
customer_reviews.text: While preparing for travel, I bought a new, lightweight 13" laptop and this bag. I was able to carry my SLR, the new laptop, a telephoto lens, and lots of little necessities in the bag. It makes a nice bug out bag for web site developers and, although a little nerdy, it looks pretty masculine. Also, it's very sturdy; it looks as good as the day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Technocrat

customer_reviews.title: Bigger In Person Than It Appears Online
customer_reviews.text: This bag is much thicker and stiffer than I expected from the photographs I had seen of the product. I returned the product since it was not the compact answer to my prayers I'd hoped for. It is certainly rugged and will hold plenty of gear, but it is not the dream bag for carrying photo equipment around all day in my opinion. I did not like the materials or construction of this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it !
customer_reviews.text: Solid feel. Great looks. Enough pockets without having too many. In mine I carry a Canon 50D with battery grip, 70-300, 18-70, 600 RT speedlite and many other small items. After all that. I still have room to slide my laptop in the side.
customer_reviews.author: Tab

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! Durable and easy to use. I took it all across Europe and it fit everything I needed to carry, such as my DSLR, Ipad and much more.
customer_reviews.author: Spoon

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and well designed
customer_reviews.text: I had to remove the velcro on the front since they kept ruining my clothes if I left the bag undone. Otherwise, sturdy and well designed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kiley

customer_reviews.title: The perfect messenger bag!
customer_reviews.text: This bag has become my "go to" bag for all kinds of uses. The highest praise I can give it is that I can't think of a single flaw. This bag does exactly what it should - period. If there is a better messenger bag on the market I haven't seen it. Every detail is well thought out and it has performed perfectly from day one. If you need a messenger type bag you need to give this one a serious look.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Tenbas are the superior bags for cameras and computers
customer_reviews.text: I've used Tenba bags since 1978 when the #795 and #995 rust colored bags first appeared. Over the years, I've probably bought more than a dozen Tenba bags. My 2 recent purchases of the larger messenger bags, one for my new camera gear and one for a new MacBook Pro are indicative of the whole line. Well thought out, well crafted and great value for the $$$$.
customer_reviews.author: prrbill

customer_reviews.title: Excelent bag I wish it had more room though
customer_reviews.text: I think this is an awesome bag. It has a lot of room for what it is, however if you have a battery grip on the camera you are going to have problems. If you don't it will hold your cam, a couple 3 lenses and a good size lens. It has many many pockets for all kinds of things, Also it can hold your laptop in a special compartment. It does have a little room between the camera holder and the bag. I just put the flash there and snugged it right up. All in all I would and probably will buy another one of these bags. they are great for carrying equipment around with.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: It’s in the bag!
customer_reviews.text: Love this new camera bag. It is top quality. It is used to transport and protect my camera and zoom lens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is in love. He's been thru over 8 bags and finally found the perfect one. The size is perfect. The compartments are fantastic. The options are grand. And it's easy to carry and comfortable. Well done Tenba!!!
customer_reviews.author: T Lounds

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag for full size cameras
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my new micro 4/3 camera, the bag is a bit large for that. It was made for a larger camera. The bag is well made, I will be using it when I travel, it can fit my camera, laptop and misc stuff. I am still on the look out for a smaller walk around bag to fit my needs
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this bag to My Husband for Christmas having read many reviews. He loves it and has already moved a lot of his "stuff" into it. I have noticed his last bag is in the rubbish bag!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Virgin Island Costumer

customer_reviews.title: This works great for my basic camera needs
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my basic camera needs. If you have more than 2 lens and lot of accessories you probably would like the larger bag. I love the color and all the pockets. I feel my camera and accessories are safe in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I love about this newer model is that I can loop ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh pockets. What's that? A pocket inside a pocket? OooO! What I love about this newer model is that I can loop a small Manfroto Flash Stand into the straps (last model they weren't long enough) so that I can carry my full kit in a "go bag" like I was in Mission Impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Osher Günsberg

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and construction.  This thing holds it all.
customer_reviews.text: This thing holds it all and will be great for both travel by car or airplane. Hold everything you could need for a trip and provides maximum protection. Well built and seems like it will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Blitz Krieg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality bag. Perfect size for a mirrorless camera and a few lenses.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: but I find this bag pretty bulky. Other than that it is a great ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed the large because of the size of my laptop, but I find this bag pretty bulky. Other than that it is a great bag and is excellently made.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Blake

customer_reviews.title: Very well-designed bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 12 day vacation during which I anticipated needing my camera, two lenses, and a flash, as well as my iPad. Everything fit comfortably plus I was able to take the camera insert out to take the bag to the beach. The bag is durable and comfortable to carry. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alan E. Freed

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: This is a BIG messenger bag. It's good but it's very big. I use this when I need to go someplace, set up, and leave it. Not to easy to walk around with. The other downside is that there are no silencers for the velcro. It is very LOUD.
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag. Great price, excellent materials and lots of room. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Tdubl

customer_reviews.title: Space for everything and everything protected
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this bag on many trips. It protects my gear and has enough space for my camera (Nikon D200) plus flash, lenses, filters, charger, extra batteries, and my laptop. I like that it does not look like a camera bag. It is comfortable. After a couple years of use, it still looks new - no rips, easy to wipe off any dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Pteri

customer_reviews.title: Still new, but I love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this bag so far! I have a Canon Rebel with three lenses, which all easily fit, plus I keep some cords and books, the charger and extra battery in it. I love to have my camera accessible, so wanted messenger bag style. My favorite part is the quick access zipper on top so I can get to my camera without having the open the whole bag!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Tenba Messenger Mini Photo/Laptop Bag - Purple (638-366)
product_meta.description:
Size:Mini| Color:PurpleThe Tenba Messenger is an urban-inspired laptop bag that's designed to hold everything you need for a day; on vacation or at work; at school or at the gym. Adjustable dividers let you configure the interiorfor a wide variety of photographic or video equipment, and removing the dividers converts the Messenger Mini into a perfect, general-purpose carrying bag.Capacity: SLR body, 2-3 lenses, flash and accessories, magazines and files.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




The Tenba Messenger is an urban-inspired laptop bag that's designed to hold everything you need for a day; on vacation or at work; at school or at the gym. Adjustable dividers let you configure the interior for a wide variety of photographic or video equipment, and removing the dividers converts the Messenger Mini into a perfect, general-purpose carrying bag. 

Quick Access™ Zipperlets you access the contents of the bag without opening the main flap









Exterior of 1000 Denier Nylonthe most time-tested and proven outdoor textile ever. The optimal combination of strength, durability, and light weight






Webbing Loops on both sides to attach a compact camera pouch or other clip-on accessories (not included)







Padded compartment holds and protects laptop. The Mini fits iPad or netbook/laptop up to 13-inch Macbook Pro size









Huge, Fully-lined Main Compartmentholds books, files, camera gear and more







Many Pockets and Compartmentsto keep mobile hard drives, cell phone, MP3 player, cables, chargers, pens and business cards organized and easily accessible







Weight 1.8 lbs (0.8 kg) Exterior Dimensions 14W x 10.5H X 4-6 in. (36 x 27 x 10-15 cm) Interior Dimensions 13.5W X 9.5H X 3.5-5.5 in. (34 X 24 X 9-14 cm)

Laptop Compartment 13W X 9.2H X 1-2 in. (33W X 23H X 3-5D cm) Fits iPad, tablet or laptop up to 13 inches Capacity DSLR with 2-3 lenses, flash and accessories, magazines and files
feature_bullets: Quick Access zipper lets you at the contents of the bag without opening the main flap
Exterior of 1000 Denier Nylon - the most time-tested and proven outdoor textile ever. The optimal combination of strength, durability, and light weight
Webbing loops on both sides to attach a compact camera pouch or other clip-on accessories (not included)
Padded compartment holds and protects laptop. The Mini fits iPad or netbook/laptop up to 13-inch Macbook Pro size
Many pockets and compartments to keep mobile hard drives, cell phone, MP3 player, cables, chargers, pens and business cards organized and easily accessible
